title: Emmanuel Macron has continually played bad cop at Brexit. Now he could be Boris Johnson's unlikely ally
text:
If Boris Johnson thinks he will be alone against 27 EU leaders at Thursday’s crunch summit in Brussels, he need only turn to his cross-Channel neighbour, Emmanuel Macron, for consolation.

Indeed, if anything, given the current political thermals at play, the French president may start the summit the more isolated of the pair.

After months of icy exchanges, the Prime Minister finally faces a thaw over the "positive momentum" towards an eleventh-hour Brexit deal - even if a "technical extension" now looks on the cards.

"There is a possibility of an accord, everyone recognises that," a French presidential aide acknowledged on Tuesday night.
